value.title: Pro basketball reemerging in Asia amid coronavirus recovery
value.excerpt: Professional basketball appears set to return to the first countries in Asia inflicted with the coronavirus, though it likely will be played without spectators. Games in South Korea, which drew worldwide praise for its success in containing the virus, seem closest to returning. South Korea's league, the KBL, has games scheduled at the end of ...

value.title: Peru deploys military to slow coronavirus spread; Chile closes borders
value.excerpt: Peru’s government deployed masked military personnel to block major roads in Lima on Monday, while police restricted the movement of people as the country rolled out a state of enforced “social isolation” to slow the spread of coronavirus.

value.title: Polls show majority of Japanese people don't expect Olympics to go on as scheduled
value.excerpt: The IOC and Tokyo 2020 organizing committee have maintained that the Summer Olympics will go on as scheduled despite the ongoing spread of the novel coronavirus. But recent polls show the Japanese public isn't so sure. Nearly 70% of people in Japan do not expect the Tokyo Olympics to be held as scheduled beginning July 24, according to the ...

value.title: Beijing Tells Pompeo It Is Futile to Smear China Over Virus
value.excerpt: Top Chinese diplomat Yang Jiechi has told U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo by telephone that attempts to smear China's efforts to control the coronavirus "will not succeed", Chinese state broadcaster CCTV reported on Monday.

value.title: How Beijing reframed the coronavirus response narrative
value.excerpt: The coronavirus outbreak started as a propaganda disaster for the Chinese government. But now — with the number of new cases falling sharply in China and rising quickly in the US and Europe — Beijing has reframed the narrative. China’s new story points to the Communist party’s success in taking draconian measures to control the disease ...

images.title: How Beijing reframed the coronavirus response narrative

value.title: Asia Distillates-Jet fuel cracks crumble to below $5 as coronavirus rattles global aviation
value.excerpt: Asian refining margins for jet fuel dropped on Monday, slumping to their lowest in more than a decade, as airlines around the world continued to scale back flights amid extensive travel restrictions due to the coronavirus pandemic.

value.title: Beijing to reopen hospital built to treat SARS patients for imported coronavirus cases: Beijing Daily
